## [3.0.12](https://github.com/tamylaa/clodo-framework/compare/v3.0.11...v3.0.12) (2025-10-14)

### Bug Fixes

* Add graceful API token permission handling and validation ([6c973b0](https://github.com/tamylaa/clodo-framework/commit/6c973b077b6e2a80b7a6d93f0b39070925bb89af))
* Add missing exists() method to WranglerConfigManager class ([44ee17c](https://github.com/tamylaa/clodo-framework/commit/44ee17c8931db085ccef502e7e7ac15209b222a5))
* Ensure wrangler uses correct account for API token operations ([f671b10](https://github.com/tamylaa/clodo-framework/commit/f671b1004057b94dd8ba55c5c1f3c2d5bca54706))
fix: Add missing exists() method to WranglerConfigManager class

fix: Ensure wrangler uses correct account for API token operations

- Set CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN environment variable when API credentials provided
- Update WranglerConfigManager to accept and set account_id in wrangler.toml
- Configure wrangler.toml account_id to match API token account
- Fixes account mismatch between database creation (API) and migrations/deployment (OAuth)
- Ensures all Cloudflare operations use the same account when API tokens are provided

fix: Add graceful API token permission handling and validation

- Enhanced CloudflareAPI with specific error messages for 401/403 errors
- Added checkD1Permissions() method to validate API token capabilities
- Updated InputCollector to check D1 permissions during token validation
- Added graceful fallback to OAuth when API token lacks permissions
- Provides clear guidance on required permissions and token updates
- Warns users about account differences when falling back to OAuth
- Prevents deployment failures with actionable error messages

## [2.0.18](https://github.com/tamylaa/clodo-framework/compare/v2.0.17...v2.0.18) (2025-10-12)

### Bug Fixes

* **deployment:** Critical deployment fixes - migrations, worker deployment, status tracking ([23c07e9](https://github.com/tamylaa/clodo-framework/commit/23c07e9a68fa4eb52ccd0df9421eff7d91919cb1)), closes [#2](https://github.com/tamylaa/clodo-framework/issues/2) [#3](https://github.com/tamylaa/clodo-framework/issues/3) [#4](https://github.com/tamylaa/clodo-framework/issues/4)

fix(deployment): Critical deployment fixes - migrations, worker deployment, status tracking

CRITICAL FIXES v2.0.19:

1.  Database Migration Command (Issue #2 from analysis)
   - Fixed buildMigrationCommand() to properly handle --env vs --local
   - OLD (BROKEN): Always added --env flag, even with --local
   - NEW (FIXED): --local only (no --env) for development, --env for remote
   - Wrangler requires: local dev = --local ONLY, no --env flag
   - Error was: 'No environment found with name development'

2.  Actual Worker Deployment (Issue #3 from analysis)
   - Replaced deployDomainWorker() placeholder with real implementation
   - Executes: npx wrangler deploy with proper environment flags
   - Parses output for worker URL and custom domain URL
   - Comprehensive error handling with helpful diagnostics
   - Timeout protection (2 min) and large buffer (10MB)
   - OLD: Mock URL returned, no actual deployment
   - NEW: Real wrangler deploy executed, both URLs captured

3.  Deployment Status Tracking (Issue #4 from analysis)
   - Enhanced DeploymentCoordinator.deploySingleDomain() with phase tracking
   - Tracks each phase: {success, errors[], warnings[]}
   - Distinguishes critical errors (stop deployment) vs warnings (continue)
   - Critical phases: validation, initialization, deployment
   - Warning phases: database, secrets, post-validation (can fail gracefully)
   - Shows accurate completion status:
     * All phases successful:  deployed successfully
     * Has warnings:   deployed with warnings + phase summary
     * Has critical errors:  deployment failed
   - NEW: displayPhaseWarnings() shows detailed phase-by-phase results

Files Changed:
- src/database/database-orchestrator.js: buildMigrationCommand() logic fixed
- src/orchestration/multi-domain-orchestrator.js: Real worker deployment + exec imports
- src/orchestration/modules/DeploymentCoordinator.js: Phase result tracking
- DEPLOYMENT_OUTPUT_ANALYSIS.md: Complete line-by-line analysis of user deployment

Testing:
-  All 16/16 test suites passing
-  132/133 tests passing
-  No linting errors
-  npm run build successful

Impact:
- Database migrations should now succeed for local development
- Worker deployment now actually deploys to Cloudflare
- Deployment status accurately reflects what actually happened
- Users see clear warnings vs errors with actionable feedback

Next Deployment Test Expected:
 Database migration succeeds (correct --local flag)
 Worker deploys successfully (real wrangler command)
 Health check attempts on actual worker URL
 Accurate status: success/warnings/failure based on actual results

## [2.0.17](https://github.com/tamylaa/clodo-framework/compare/v2.0.16...v2.0.17) (2025-10-12)

### Bug Fixes

* use ConfigurationValidator as static class, not instance ([12caaeb](https://github.com/tamylaa/clodo-framework/commit/12caaeba17426239f98dacd2fdb36ac45a7a496b))

fix: use ConfigurationValidator as static class, not instance

CRITICAL BUG - Line-by-Line Analysis:
Error: 'this.configValidator.validate is not a function'

ROOT CAUSE (Traced):
Line 65: this.configValidator = new ConfigurationValidator()   WRONG
Line 228: this.configValidator.validate(config, env)           Calls instance method

ConfigurationValidator.js Line 32:
  static validate(config, environment)   STATIC METHOD!

All other usage in codebase:
  SecurityCLI.js: ConfigurationValidator.validateConfiguration()   Static
  index.js: ConfigurationValidator.validate()                     Static

### Bug Fixes

fix: comprehensive readline state management and stdin restoration

ROOT CAUSE ANALYSIS:
After askPassword() collects hidden API token input, stdin is left in corrupted state:
- setRawMode(true) enables raw mode for password masking
- stdin.pause() stops stdin after password collection
- BUT original state was NEVER restored
- InputCollector's readline becomes unusable for subsequent prompts
- Domain selection prompt hangs forever (no timeout before this fix)

COMPREHENSIVE FIXES (Systematic, Not Patches):

1. askPassword() State Restoration:
   - Save original stdin state (isRaw, isPaused)
   - Restore state BEFORE resolving promise
   - Resume stdin so readline can use it
   - Add 50ms stabilization delay
   - Handle Ctrl+C gracefully
   - Support both CR and LF (cross-platform)

2. InputCollector Readline Health:
   - Lazy initialization via ensureReadline()
   - Auto-recreate if closed or corrupted
   - Check stdin.readable before prompts
   - Proper cleanup in close() with null reference

3. Auto-Select Single Domain:
   - Eliminates prompt when only 1 domain available
   - Bypasses readline issue entirely for common case
   - Clear feedback to user

4. Timeout Protection:
   - 120s timeout on all question() calls
   - Helpful error messages on timeout
   - Suggests non-interactive mode

5. Enhanced Error Handling:
   - Context-aware error messages
   - Diagnostic suggestions based on error type
   - DEBUG mode for full stack traces

6. Progress Indicators:
   - Show 'Fetching Cloudflare configuration...'
   - User knows system is working, not hung

ARCHITECTURE IMPROVEMENTS:
- Created DEPLOYMENT_FAILURE_ANALYSIS.md with complete flow map
- Identified ALL potential failure scenarios
- Designed systematic solutions for each
- Added health checks and defensive programming
- Proper state management throughout async chain

TESTING:
- All 16/16 test suites passing
- Works across PowerShell, cmd, bash
- Handles single/multiple domains
- Graceful degradation on errors

This eliminates the silent exit issue and ensures readline works properly
throughout the entire deployment flow.

2. Investigating root causes
3. Keeping method names consistent across modules

## [2.0.6](https://github.com/tamylaa/clodo-framework/compare/v2.0.5...v2.0.6) (2025-10-11)

### Bug Fixes

* PowerShell double-echo in interactive input collection ([6a4b153](https://github.com/tamylaa/clodo-framework/commit/6a4b15380efac0ffc4b57ea4e24f320853c33137))

fix: PowerShell double-echo in interactive input collection

PROBLEM:
When running 'npx clodo-service deploy --interactive' in PowerShell,
characters were being echoed twice:
  Input: 'data-service'
  Displayed: 'ddaattaa--sseerrvviiccee'

ROOT CAUSE:
PowerShell's terminal emulation causes Node.js readline module to
echo input characters twice. This is a known PowerShell + readline bug.

SOLUTION:
Detect PowerShell environment (PSModulePath env variable) and disable
terminal mode in readline when running in PowerShell:

  terminal: !isPowerShell

This prevents the double-echo while maintaining proper input handling.

IMPACT:
- Interactive mode now works correctly in PowerShell
- No impact on bash/zsh/other shells
- All 117 tests still passing

TESTING:
Tested in:
- Windows PowerShell 5.1
- PowerShell Core 7.x
- CMD would also benefit from this fix
- Bash/zsh unaffected (terminal mode still enabled)

docs: add git workflow tools to prevent push rejections

Added comprehensive tooling to solve the recurring 'rejected push' issue:

PROBLEM:
- Semantic-release pushes commits to master from CI
- Local commits made without pulling first create divergent histories
- Pushes get rejected with 'non-fast-forward' error
- This happens repeatedly and is frustrating

SOLUTION:
1. Safe push script (scripts/utilities/safe-push.ps1)
   - Automatically fetches, rebases, and pushes
   - Prevents push rejections

2. Git configuration (.gitconfig-local)
   - Sets pull.rebase=true (no merge commits)
   - Adds useful aliases: sync, pushsafe, st

3. NPM scripts
   - npm run push:safe - Use the safe push workflow
   - npm run sync - Sync with remote before working

4. Documentation (docs/PREVENTING_PUSH_REJECTIONS.md)
   - Complete guide on the problem and solutions
   - Best practices for team collaboration
   - Troubleshooting guide

USAGE:
  npm run push:safe  # Instead of: git push
  npm run sync       # Before starting work

This ensures clean, linear git history that works seamlessly
with semantic-release CI workflows.
